resources.string:
You are welcome to class.
So glad you could make it
 I hope you are ready for today's questions?

Press the START button below to start.
ARE YOU READY!! \n\nPlease choose the subject you would like to do
I just completed my quiz questions with %1$d/10 correct answers

NOUN: A word (other than pronoun) used to identify any class of a people, places, or things.

PRONOUN: A word used to refer to someone or something instead of a noun.

VERB: A word that indicates a physical action, mental action, or a state of being (e.g., drive, dance, think, exist).

ADVERB: A word or an expression that generally modifies a verb, adjective, another adverb.

ADJECTIVE: A word that describes a noun or noun phrase.

PREPOSITION: A word or group of words used before a noun or pronoun, or noun phrase to show direction, time, place, location, spatial relationships, or to introduce and object (e.g., in, at, on, of, to).

SYNONYMS: A word, or phrase that means exactly or nearly the same as another word.

ANTONYM: A word that is opposite in meaning to another given word.
Click the button below to take the next quiz
Click the button below to start again
Unscramble the word using all the letters.
Do you want to exit the app? Your progress would be lost.
Please select what you would like to do.\n
